remarks: Two-dimensional commutation of a group sum.  Note that while ` A ` and ` D ` are constants w.r.t. ` j , k ` , ` C ( j ) ` and ` E ( k ) ` are not.  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 28-Dec-2014.)
statement:
gsum2d2.b $e |- B = ( Base ` G ) $.
gsum2d2.z $e |- .0. = ( 0g ` G ) $.
gsum2d2.g $e |- ( ph -> G e. CMnd ) $.
gsum2d2.a $e |- ( ph -> A e. V ) $.
gsum2d2.r $e |- ( ( ph /\ j e. A ) -> C e. W ) $.
gsum2d2.f $e |- ( ( ph /\ ( j e. A /\ k e. C ) ) -> X e. B ) $.
gsum2d2.u $e |- ( ph -> U e. Fin ) $.
gsum2d2.n $e |- ( ( ph /\ ( ( j e. A /\ k e. C ) /\ -. j U k ) ) -> X = .0. ) $.
gsumcom2.d $e |- ( ph -> D e. Y ) $.
gsumcom2.c $e |- ( ph -> ( ( j e. A /\ k e. C ) <-> ( k e. D /\ j e. E ) ) ) $.
gsumcom2 $p |- ( ph -> ( G gsum ( j e. A , k e. C |-> X ) ) = ( G gsum ( k e. D , j e. E |-> X ) ) ) $.
$d .0. j k $.
$d A j k $.
$d B j k $.
$d C k $.
$d D j k $.
$d E j $.
$d G j k $.
$d U j k $.
$d V j $.
$d j k ph $.
